title: How to Put Together a Basic Pruning Kit

steps.headline: Get some decent garden gloves.
steps.description: If you don't already have a good pair, get some. They're essential for protecting your hands from sharp edges, thorns, and prickles when you're pruning.

steps.headline: Purchase quality secateurs.
steps.description: You'll use these for a lot of pruning jobs, so be prepared to spend a decent amount on them. Secateurs are good for fine pruning tasks.

steps.headline: Purchase loppers.
steps.description: These should be medium-sized. They are ideal for pruning branches that are thin. You can also use loppers to thin out branches.

steps.headline: Purchase a handsaw.
steps.description: A handsaw is needed for tougher branches and thicker branches. Be sure to check its sturdiness when buying it; avoid anything that is wobbly or bends.

steps.headline: Purchase shears.
steps.description: These are ideal for dead-heading and trimming.

text: Get some decent garden gloves. If you don't already have a good pair, get some. They're essential for protecting your hands from sharp edges, thorns, and prickles when you're pruning. Purchase quality secateurs. You'll use these for a lot of pruning jobs, so be prepared to spend a decent amount on them. Secateurs are good for fine pruning tasks. Purchase loppers. These should be medium-sized. They are ideal for pruning branches that are thin. You can also use loppers to thin out branches. Purchase a handsaw. A handsaw is needed for tougher branches and thicker branches. Be sure to check its sturdiness when buying it; avoid anything that is wobbly or bends. Purchase shears. These are ideal for dead-heading and trimming.
